implementation.name: main_calculator_loop
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the main calculator logic, including addition when the user selects option 1. Handles user input for numbers and operation selection.
implementation.pseudo_code:
PRINT welcome message
LOOP forever:
    PRINT menu options
    GET user choice as integer
    GET first number as integer
    GET second number as integer
    IF choice == 1:
        PRINT Output: num1 + num2
    ELSE IF choice == 2:
        PRINT Output: num1 - num2
    ELSE IF choice == 3:
        PRINT Output: num1 * num2
    ELSE IF choice == 4:
        PRINT Output: num1 / num2
    ELSE IF choice == 5:
        PRINT Exiting...
        BREAK loop
    PRINT newline

missing_implementations: Show the error if any of the input is having the error
Given two numbers, the greater number should be subtracted by the smaller one.
Output can be negative or positive.
Input numbers can be negative or positive.

implementation.name: main calculator loop
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements a menu-driven calculator. When the user selects option 3 (Multiplication), it multiplies two input numbers and prints the output.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Print welcome message
Loop forever:
    Print menu options
    Get user choice
    Get first number
    Get second number
    IF choice == 1:
        Print sum
    ELSE IF choice == 2:
        Print difference
    ELSE IF choice == 3:
        Print product (num1 * num2)
    ELSE IF choice == 4:
        Print division
    ELSE IF choice == 5:
        Print exit message
        Break loop
    Print newline

implementation.name: Division branch in calculator main loop
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements division operation when user selects option 4. Directly performs division using num1 / num2 and prints the result.
implementation.pseudo_code:
IF user selects option 4 (Division):
    Prompt for first number (num1)
    Prompt for second number (num2)
    Output: num1 / num2

missing_implementations: Should not be divided by zero.
Always handle the exception of dividing by zero.
